Comparing Folder and Item Properties

If you have Enterprise Advantage, you can use the View Comparison utility to compare the properties of items other than files – that is, folders, change requests, requirements, topics, and tasks. If you have other versions of StarTeam, you will not be able to make all of these comparisons.

Remember that tasks and topics never branch. Therefore, if a topic exists in more than one project view with a current configuration, changing the topic in one view changes it in the other views. As a result, your source and target views may never contain a task or topic that needs merging, unless you have reconfigured at least one of the views.

To compare items other than files:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Select the appropriate tab from the lower pane of the View Comparison window.

  4. Select a pair of folders or items from the item pane. Remember that items that do not exist in both views cannot be compared.

  5. Do one of the following:

    • From the Item or context menu, select Compare Items.

    • Click the Compare Items button on the toolbar.

  6. If a selected pair of items has the same properties in both the source and target folders, the application displays a message stating that the items are identical.

    7. An icon that shows two pieces of blank paper, side-by-side, identifies identical items unless Use merge tracking for merge resolution has been selected. If this option is selected, the same icon indicates that the properties of the two items have not changed since the last recorded merge in either direction. Note that this option works as a toggle. Right-click on an item in the lower pane, and choose Display > Use merge tracking for merge resolution.

  7. If a selected pair of items has different properties in both folders, the Compare dialog displays the properties of the items side-by-side. Properties that differ appear in boldface type.

  8. Use the <<Previous and Next>> buttons to move from one pair of items to the next.

Note: Custom fields appear in the dialogs that compare properties, unless the fields are disabled.
